dcterms:description: Full-disk line-of-sight magnetogram images used for predicting solar flares, sampled hourly and labeled based on maximum peak X-ray flux within the next 24 hours.
dcterms:title: Helioseismic and Magnetic Imager (HMI)

dcterms:creator: W. Pesnell
B.J. Thompson
P.C. Chamberlin
dcterms:description: The Solar Dynamics Observatory (SDO) provides comprehensive observations of the Sun, including data crucial for solar flare prediction.
dcterms:title: Solar Dynamics Observatory (SDO)

dcterms:creator: L. Fletcher
B.R. Dennis
H.S. Hudson

dcterms:description: NOAA flare classes categorize solar flares based on their peak X-ray flux levels, which are critical for understanding solar activity and its impacts.
dcterms:title: NOAA flare classes

dcterms:creator: X. Huang
H. Wang
L. Xu
J. Liu
R. Li
X. Dai
dcterms:description: Active Region (AR) patches extracted from line-of-sight magnetograms used for training deep learning models to predict solar flares.
dcterms:title: Active Region (AR) patches

dcterms:creator: X. Li
Y. Zheng
X. Wang
L. Wang
dcterms:description: Datasets for predicting solar flares categorized into C1.0, M1.0, and X1.0 classes, used to train deep convolutional neural networks.
dcterms:title: Solar flare prediction datasets (C1.0, M1.0, X1.0 classes)
